Rule.NonCompliantComment: The latest SQL Server cumulative and security updates are not installed, leaving the server vulnerable to known vulnerabilities.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the latest SQL Server cumulative and security updates are installed to protect against known vulnerabilities.
Rule.Correction: 1. Visit the Microsoft SQL Server updates page: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/sql/releases/download-and-install-latest-updates 2. Download and install the latest cumulative and security updates. 3. Restart the SQL Server service to apply the updates.
Rule.Verification: SELECT SERVERPROPERTY('ProductLevel') AS SP_installed, SERVERPROPERTY('ProductVersion') AS Version, SERVERPROPERTY('ProductUpdateLevel') AS 'ProductUpdate_Level', SERVERPROPERTY('ProductUpdateReference') AS 'KB_Number';

Rule.NonCompliantComment: SQL Server is installed on a multi-function server, which increases the attack surface and may impact performance.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure SQL Server is installed on a single-function member server dedicated to database operations only.
Rule.Correction: 1. Review the server roles and installed applications. 2. Migrate unrelated applications and services to other servers. 3. Restrict the server's role to database operations.
Rule.Verification: SELECT SERVERPROPERTY('IsClustered') AS IsClustered, SERVERPROPERTY('EngineEdition') AS EngineEdition;
